intro: Galium boreale var. koreanum, commonly known as Korean bedstraw, is a flowering plant native to parts of East Asia, including Korea. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, ascending stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of tiny white flowers that bloom in early summer, followed by small, spherical berries. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors and stream banks. Galium boreale var. koreanum is often found in temperate regions with cool, humid climates.
